parts.text: {"word":"self-heal","priority":"★☆☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"ヒメハギ（姫萩）","english_definition":"A common Eurasian and North American herbaceous plant (Prunella vulgaris) of the mint family, traditionally used medicinally.","examples":[{"sentence":"Self-heal is known for its purported wound-healing properties.","translation":"ヒメハギは、傷を癒す効果があると言われています。"},{"sentence":"The meadow was dotted with self-heal and other wildflowers.","translation":"その牧草地には、ヒメハギや他の野草が点在していました。"}],"collocations":["self-heal extract","self-heal ointment","wild self-heal"],"synonyms":["Prunella vulgaris","heal-all"],"antonyms":[]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","definition":"自己治癒する","english_definition":"(of a wound, injury, or illness) to heal without external intervention.","examples":[{"sentence":"Minor cuts often self-heal within a few days.","translation":"小さな切り傷は、数日以内に自然に治癒することがよくあります。"},{"sentence":"The body has an amazing ability to self-heal.","translation":"人体には、驚くべき自己治癒能力があります。"}],"collocations":["self-heal quickly","ability to self-heal"],"synonyms":["heal naturally","recover spontaneously"],"antonyms":["require treatment","worsen"]}],"etymology":{"value":"The name 'self-heal' comes from the plant's traditional use in herbal medicine to treat wounds and other ailments.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˌselfˈhiːl/","syllables":"self-heal"},"inflection":{"noun_plural":"self-heals","verb_forms":{"present_simple":["self-heal","self-heals"],"past_simple":"self-healed","past_participle":"self-healed","present_participle":"self-healing"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Self-heal' can refer to the plant itself, or to the process of natural healing. When referring to the plant, it is a noun. When referring to the healing process, it can be used as a verb or in a compound adjective (e.g., 'self-healing properties').","priority":"★★☆"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ I used self-heal to the cut.","correct":"✓ I used self-heal on the cut.","note":"When referring to applying the plant or its extract, use 'on' rather than 'to'."},{"incorrect":"✗ The wound was self heal.","correct":"✓ The wound was self-healing.","note":"When describing the process of healing, use the present participle form 'self-healing'."}],"priority":"★☆☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["self-healing (adjective, noun)"],"phrasal_verbs":[],"priority":"★☆☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"Low","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"The term 'self-heal' has two main meanings: it refers to a plant traditionally used for medicinal purposes, and it describes the body's natural ability to recover from injuries or illnesses. The plant, Prunella vulgaris, is a common herb found in various regions. The concept of 'self-healing' is often used in discussions about health, wellness, and the body's innate capabilities. Understanding the context is crucial to interpreting the intended meaning.","example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The herbalist recommended a poultice made from **self-heal** to soothe the rash.","translation":"その薬草医は、発疹を鎮めるためにヒメハギで作った湿布を勧めました。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"plant"},{"sentence":"The skin has an amazing capacity to **self-heal** after minor injuries.","translation":"皮膚には、軽傷の後に自然治癒する驚くべき能力があります。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"healing"},{"sentence":"Scientists are studying the **self-healing** properties of certain materials.","translation":"科学者たちは、特定の材料の自己修復特性を研究しています。","type":"adjective","meaning_category":"healing"}]}
